definition: Umweltgesetze refers to a set of regulations and laws that are primarily concerned with the protection and preservation of the natural environment. These laws are typically implemented by a government or governing body to regulate human activities that may have an impact on the environment. Umweltgesetze encompass a wide range of topics, including pollution control, waste management, conservation of natural resources, and the prevention of environmental damage. They are commonly used in discussions related to sustainability, environmental policy, and legal frameworks for environmental protection.

examples.german: Umweltgesetze sind Gesetze, die den Schutz der Umwelt regeln.
examples.english: Environmental laws are laws that regulate the protection of the environment.

examples.german: Die Umweltgesetze sollen Umweltschäden verhindern und den nachhaltigen Umgang mit Ressourcen fördern.
examples.english: Environmental laws are intended to prevent environmental damage and promote sustainable use of resources.

examples.german: Die Einhaltung der Umweltgesetze ist für Unternehmen verpflichtend.
examples.english: Compliance with environmental laws is mandatory for companies.

examples.german: Umweltgesetze legen fest, welche Emissionen und Abfälle erlaubt sind.
examples.english: Environmental laws determine which emissions and waste are allowed.

examples.german: Die Umweltgesetze werden regelmäßig überprüft und aktualisiert, um den aktuellen Umweltstandards gerecht zu werden.
examples.english: Environmental laws are regularly reviewed and updated to meet current environmental standards.
